required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase I, Single-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled Single-Ascending Dose, First Time Into Man Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, and PK of AZD8529 in Healthy Subjects Part B: A Randomized, Open Label Study to Assess the Effect of Food on AZD 8529

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study to evaluate safety, tolerability, PK and PD effects of orally administered AZD8529 after single ascending doses

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the safety and tolerability of single dose administration of AZD8529 when given orally to healthy male subjects and female subjects of non-childbearing potential.
primary_outcome.time_frame: at each visit, at least daily, during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize the pharmacokinetics of AZD8529 in plasma and urine.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood and urine samples will be taken during the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: To asses the effect of food on the safety and pharmacokinetic profile of AZD8529.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Safety assessments and blood and urine samples will be taken throughout the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male or female subjects aged 18 to 45 years (inclusive) on Day 1. Female subjects must be of non-child bearing potential.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has received another new chemical entity (defined as a compound which has not been approved for marketing) or has participated in any other clinical study that included drug treatment within 3 months of the first administration of investigational prod
- Plasma donation within one month of screening or any blood donation/blood loss > 500mL during the 3 months prior to screening
- Clinically relevant abnormalities in physical examinations, vital signs, ECG, clinical chemistry, hematology or urinalysis
